pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.10: The Pali text just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as in bhikkhu-saṅghādisesa 10, Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
